These test that failed for you...

 > Tests in error:
 >   testSearchOrder(org.archive.i18n.LocaleCacheTest)

...succeeds for us. Since it's localization-related, it may be due to a 
difference in your JVM or OS configuration.

What local language/etc. preferences are configured in your OS installation?

Can you find the specific test results in the file named by your mvn 
output, /home/sysk/Desktop/heritrix2/commons/target/surefire-reports, 
and forward to us?

Perhaps we can fix the test or underlying class.

- Gordon @ IA

> Do you have any idea about why im getting this error? Is it related to
> my setup info?
> 
>> egh@gales:~/tmp/heritrix2$ ~/software/maven-2.0.7/bin/mvn install
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Erik Hetzner
> <erik.hetzner@...> wrote:
>> At Wed, 22 Oct 2008 10:08:51 -0700 (PDT),
>> Mathew Nik Foscarini <nfoscarini@...> wrote:
>>> I tried for 2 days to get it to compile.
>>>
>>> I was never able to get it to work inside Eclipse. The Maven plugin
>>> will not work for me.
>>>
>>> I did have better results from the command line, but not anything
>>> usable.
>>>
>>> Running "maven install" on the main pom.xml only works if I manually
>>> run "maven install" on each subproject first, after that "maven
>>> install" on the main pom.xml always reports a failed build but least
>>> it does a lot of work before failing.
>>>
>>> I've also had problems with java complaining about missing jar files
>>> from the local user repository.
>>>
>>> At one point I was able to get Eclipse to compile the code, and run
>>> Heritrix, but only if I used the war file from the release package
>>> on the command line, but after that none of my code changes would
>>> appear in the Heritrix UI.
>>>
>>> Yea, I feel your pain. Unlike Heritrix 1.12 which I got running in
> an hour.
>> I dislike maven as much as anybody. But it compiles fine for me. What
>> java/os/maven version are you using? Could you describe the problem a
>> little more? Maven does require a working internet connection to
>> download all dependencies, etc.
>>
>> I assume that you mean ‘mvn’ - ‘maven’ is the maven 1 binary.
>>
>> I would definitely run mvn from the command line first before I tried
>> to get it set up in Eclipse.
>>
>> The following sequence works for me:
>>
>> egh@gales:~/tmp$ ~/software/maven-2.0.7/bin/mvn --version
>> Maven version: 2.0.7
>> Java version: 1.6.0_07
>> OS name: "linux" version: "2.6.24-19-386" arch: "i386"
>>
>> egh@gales:~/tmp$ $JAVA_HOME/bin/java -version
>> java version "1.6.0_07"
>> Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_07-b06)
>> Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 10.0-b23, mixed mode, sharing)
>>
>> egh@gales:~/tmp$ rm -rf ~/.m2 # delete maven repository, cached
> stuff, etc.
>> egh@gales:~/tmp$ svn co
> https://archive-crawler.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/archive-crawler/trunk/heritrix2
>> egh@gales:~/tmp$ cd heritrix2
>>
>> egh@gales:~/tmp/heritrix2$ ~/software/maven-2.0.7/bin/mvn install
